name: Shimenawa Rope
description: Sacred rope used to mark objects or places as pure. Used for enhancing spirit rarity.

name: Gohei Amulet
description: Amulet made of white paper traditionally used in purification rituals. It connects the sacred with the earthly, providing protection and purification.

name: Kagura Bell
description: Sacred bell used in the Kagura ritual dances, a ceremonial art dedicated to the gods. These bells are used to enhance the spiritual connection of spirits and purify the area.

name: Ofuda Talisman
description: Paper talisman with sacred writings, used to protect or purify an area. It is employed in summoning rituals to repel negative influences and strengthen the spiritual bond.

name: Tamagushi Branch
description: Sakaki branch adorned with washi paper strips, used in offering rituals to the gods. It is a symbol of respect and devotion in Japanese culture.

name: Omamori Amulet
description: A protective amulet commonly used in daily life to bring luck or protection. In the game context, it is associated with the elements Healing and Light.

name: Hitogata Doll
description: A paper or straw figure used in rituals to transfer impurities and perform purification. It is employed to remove curses or negative states from spirits.

name: Suzu Bell
description: Small bells used to invoke good fortune and repel evil. In rituals, they help harmonize energy. Associated with the elements Air and Metal, they amplify the offensive power of spirits.

name: Sakaki Branch
description: Branch of the sakaki tree, considered sacred in Shinto tradition and used in ceremonies to honor the gods. Associated with the elements Wood and Earth.

name: Inro Box
description: A small box traditionally used to store medicines or precious herbs. It represents care and protection.

name: Hokora Shrine
description: A small portable shrine used to worship local deities or minor kami. It provides a direct link to the divine.

name: Kōdō Incense
description: Incense used in ceremonies to attract good fortune and purify the environment, creating a favorable atmosphere for meditation and spiritual strengthening.

name: Magatama Jewel
description: A comma-shaped jewel symbolizing protection and spirituality, used as an amulet of power and connection to the divine.

name: Shakujō Staff
description: A ceremonial staff used by Buddhist monks, symbolizing spiritual authority and the power to ward off evil spirits.

name: Mizuhiki Knot
description: A decorative cord used in gifts and ceremonies to symbolize connection and the wish for prosperity.
